intro: Cnidium ajanense f. latisectum, commonly known as the broad-leafed cnidium, is a rare variant of the cnidium plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features distinctive, broad, lobed leaves that set it apart from other cnidium species. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces dark brown, dry fruits. The botanical interest in this plant lies in its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
